Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cell

  • public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    A Cell object represents a single cell in the grid of Conway's Game of Life. It keeps track of its neighbours and whether it is alive or dead.
    Author:
    jonesgare1

      • getY

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.List<Cell> getNeighbours()

      • setNeighbours

        public void setNeighbours(java.util.List<Cell> neighbours)
        Sets the neighbours of this cell. Should be run once by the Grid class, once all the cells have been created.
        Parameters:
        neighbours - The up-to-8 Cells adjacent to this cell

      • prepareForUpdate

        public void prepareForUpdate()
        Calculate the correct value of willBeAlive. Applies the rules of Conway's Game of Life, based on the isAlive field of neighbours.

      • update

        public void update()
        Sets the current state to the next state. Always run prepareForUpdate() on all Cells before calling this.
